newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong leadership selection process.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong leadership selection process.

text.p: Hong Kong, Britain's last important colony, decides on Wednesday its first post-colonial leader to govern the territory when it reverts to China in mid-1997. Candidates are Tung Chee-hwa, Yang Ti Liang, Peter Woo.
Here is an outline of the selection process.
-- 9 a.m. (0100 GMT) China-controlled 400-member Selection Committee, presided over by Foreign Minister Qian Qichen, gathers in the Hong Kong Convention Centre hall.
-- Voting by secret ballot starts around 10 a.m. (0200 GMT).
-- Ballot papers go into an envelope before they are dropped into a ballot box.
-- Votes will be counted aloud with monitors marking score on a board visible to assembled Selection Committee.
-- First of three candidates to reach 201 votes wins.
-- If no one gets 201 votes, the top two compete in an immediate second-round run-off.
